column4: Hello guys. I need to recover some files from my broken-windows laptop so I booted using the xubuntu live cd. In which folder should I search for the windows files??
please guys, my boss is gonna cut my head out T_T
what do you mean to mount?
pastebin the output of the following commands two commands: mount && sudo fdisk -l
do you understand what you need to do?
not really, i don't understand if pastebin is a command or the name of something
it's a website.  paste.ubuntu.com go there and paste the output of the commands: mount && sudo fdisk -l
so I should type "mount && sudo fdisk -l" in the shell and then paste to paste.ubuntu.com what i get from the shell?
yes, and then give us the url
run this and type what you see: mount | grep /media
for f in sda1 sda2 sda5; do sudo mkdir /media/$f && sudo mount /dev/$f /media/$f; done
just do: sudo mkdir /media/sda1; sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/sda1     and do the same for sda5
ok looks easier now, let me try
it means it wasn't shutdown correctly
so you have to do one of the things it says (there's an option to force)
google the error, there may be better ways
